Reviews.Title: Great camera that does really take better than average pictures!
Reviews.Author: K. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I am and always have been skeptical of buying digital cameras. This is the cheapest entry and also one of the newest from Nikon that has a CMOS sensor rather than a CCD sensor. Let the argument go on who is better. When the lighting is sun light, the Nikon shines and creates wonderful photos. Low light, of course, is a typical offender of ruining a good picture. If the flash is used, most of the time it does a good job to make everything look natural and not "over-toned" in anyway or display odd contrast properties.I think this is a great product and really sells itself when you view the information offered on Nikons web site.5/14/2012 UPDATE : The flash stopped firing. I went through the reference manual and played out all scenarios in which the Flash should fire and it is not. The flash has been deemed defective my Nikon and I have been granted a return authorization. This is upsetting but I hope Nikon can give a quick turn around with my camera or just give me a new unit all together. I really do enjoy the camera when it works!5/24/2012 - 6/12/2012 UPDATE : I finally got the camera back from Nikon, parts hold made it longer than normal. I was quoted in 7-10 business days I would have the camera back and that was not true. 13 business days and a whole lot of horrible communication. I would never buy a Nikon product after the customer "service" I received.When my Canon scanner broke, without hesitation, they sent me a new scanner and said stick the old on in the new box and attach the pre-paid shipping label. Said it would take 5-7 days and it arrived in 2 days. Canon > Nikon in customer service department.2/1/2013 UPDATE : Camera still works, takes great pictures, has great battery life. I cannot say a terrible thing about the camera when it works. Yes it was annoying after it broke shortly. Yes, Nikon was over the "scheduled" time period of replacement, but it works now and still takes great pictures. They made this one cheaper, recently, so it is even a better buy unless technology did a 180* in some other direction I am not aware of.7/27/2013 UPDATE : Camera still taking great pictures, great battery life, great quality shots when the lighting is there. The only thing that I dislike is what I believe to be the most common fault of all point and shoot cameras which is the low light level pictures tend to lose a bit of quality. Sometimes the automatic color picks the incorrect filter but can you really blame the device when light bulbs come in so many different temperatures now a days? I have three different temperature light bulbs in my house, some share the same room and it can throw off the auto colors, a few quick and painless button selections and you can choose your own color filter to make the picture match the natural colors you are trying to capture. During close up shots, the flash can be a bit over bearing but rarely does this happen.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is good but Battery performance is disappointing and Camera gets hanged sometimes.
Reviews.Author: Raghu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with great expectations on photo quality and image capture options. Here goes feedbackPros :1.Photo Quality : It is upto the mark. Great photos can be captured . Photos can be zoomed in and edited with great clarity.2.Camera Menu Options: It provides wide range of image capture options with plenty of scene selector modes.Cons :1.Battery performance : It is disappointing to see that a fully charged battery can capture only 120 photos. I thought the performance will improve after first few days charging but later realized that it is not very great.2.Cannot access camera when it is charging. It is very frustrating.3. Most important one : My Camera is getting hanged every now and then , I need to remove the battery to make it work again. I am not sure is it a fault in my camera only or with all S6300 , need to contact with Nikon to check what is causing this problem.Hope this will help to make better decision.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera with tons of features
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: The quality of the photos is amazing.  The flash does a great job of taking quality images in low-light, so well that the image looks completely natural.  The camera can take consecutive photos relatively quickly and the battery lasts for hundreds of photos.The camera is a perfect size, is very portable, and takes amazing pictures (they also look very sharp when printed).  The zoom is good and the image stabilization feature is excellent.  Nikon truly makes great lenses and digital cameras, and you can't go wrong with the Coolpix S6300.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot camera for its price.
Reviews.Author: wetcow
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about four months.  My final verdict is I love it and here is why.1. It is user friendly.  I was able to figure out how to use it without using a guide.  Will except for the formatting of my SD card, I had to make a service call for that one. (Service rep was friendly and helpful)  The camera took two good pictures when I first got it, then froze up, and would not take any more pictures. I came to find out it used all of its internal memory and since my SD card was not formatted the camera had no were else to go.  Once I formatted my SD card it worked great.2.  The options.  I like the fact that I can choose to take 16 mb picture down to VGA quality picture. It does the same with the video. It has about 6 different video/ picture gradients to choose from.  The fun features it comes with is well just "wow". I love the sepia and all the different scene shots.  I Love the continuous shooting options.  I do have more trouble getting crisp pictures from this, though.3. The video is so amazing. I can hardly believe, that I own a point and shoot camera that takes video at such an amazing quality.  It still blows my mind.  I almost think the price of the camera is worth this feature alone.  And recording is so easy just hit the record button.  Love it, absolutely love it.4. The auto focus mode. It takes really good idiot proof pictures.  Not the auto scene mode just the plain full auto mode.  They are Crisp, vibrant and everything I want in a picture5. 10x optical zoom main reason I bought the camera.  It works great.I researched this camera heavily before I purchased it.  The battery system is not a problem for me because,  [...]  I made this purchase on amazon at the same time.  I now have three batteries and really good recharger.Yes this camera can take terrible pictures. I have taken some, but I would like to know of a camera that doesn't.  All of my bad pictures, I blame on me the photographer and not the camera.  But one of the short comings of this camera, that I have noticed, is that I have gotten a lot red eye shots with the flash.  I did not expect this and have not made the verdict if it is me or the camera, because in my research others have gotten great flash shots without the red eye.Bottom line this camera has met or surpassed all of my expectations and was worth every penny I put into it, and I gladly recommend it to anybody looking for a good point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Pat
Reviews.Author: Pat Nadeau
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful. It is simple to use, takes great pictures and is very compact. The zoom lense is easy to use and close up pictures are very clear. When the pictures are printed they are sharp and crisp. I would buy this camera again!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera/Easy to use
Reviews.Author: blfish
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 2 weeks before my brothers destination wedding. I had looked at numerous cameras before I chose this one.  I wanted with 10x zoom on it.  I like this camera a lot, and it was very easy to use, considering I was not able to test it out before I left on my trip.  I broght the manual with me, just in case I needed to know how do do something, and I never opened it once.  The only con I would give the camera (and I am still not sure if its a con) because I need to use it more, is the battery life.  My battery died during my brother's wedding ceremony, when I needed it the most, and I had to run back to my room to charge the battery.  That might be also because it was the first time I has used the camera on that battery charge.  But that was my only downfall on this camera. I might update this in a few weeks after I use my camera more.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: erin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my trip to the UK and let me just say it was a great choice. I've only purchased Sony cameras so I was hesitant to switch to another brand but I'm glad I did. The photos turned out wonderful, colors were vibrant and details were excellent. The zoom is great and pictures still turn out awesome even zoomed in all the way. The only issue I have with the camera is that it lags and takes few seconds to record the picture. Overall, I am happy that I decided to make the switch and I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: almost a disaster
Reviews.Author: david r. friedman
Reviews.Content: The only negative I had read about the camera was a few owners complained about the lens protector getting stuck half opened, received the Nikon one day before a two week trip from LA to Florence OR up US 1. The camera was great for the first 5 days. Picture quality is excellent and the variety of different modes is outstanding. On the 5th day, the lenses protector jammed half opened. Most upsetting. Stopped and ordered a new camera to be delivered to our next stop. Love Amazon. Later in that day, I turned on the camera again and the lenses shutter remained half opened. I poked my finger nail in between the lenses and cover and poof, the lenses shutter opened and has worked perfectly since then, about 30 days so far. So, order the camera, use it, enjoy the 10x zoom, the panorama, various settings and brilliant picture. Make sure you have a manicure before your next use and you will have no problems.

Reviews.Title: Defective Lens Mechanism !!!
Reviews.Author: Dan "Dan"
Reviews.Content: This Camera and all the following series have a defective lens mechanism. The gear to pull out and contract the lens has a defect that makes the camera unuseful. It has happened to me with two cameras of the same type. The first I bought did not work since the first time, it was replaced and after six months of use, the second camera broke down too due to the same defect. After calling to different repairing companies, all of them commented that this defect is common in this cameras and the spare parts to repair it can take long time to be  supplied.Although the pictures are great because of the color capture, the zoom and the wide focus range; this defect makes this a dispensible camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Shannan E. Fraser "Thistle"
Reviews.Content: Wonderful item. Worth the wait (pre-release purchase) and so worth the money!  The size and shape make it easy to hold, and it has many features that I am still learning how to use.

Reviews.Title: Simple and Fast
Reviews.Author: JS
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a trip I was taking to India. I didn't want to drag my DSLR equipment all over with me but wanted something that would take good pictures for a reasonable price. This did not disappoint. I always miss my DSLR level controls when I don't have them but this is quick and simple.

Reviews.Title: CoolPix
Reviews.Author: Noel Nieves
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. The quality of the video is awesome, specially the stabilization control. The picture quality for the 16 pixels is supreme. The camera works pretty fast too. No long waiting between pics.

Reviews.Title: Huge disappointment
Reviews.Author: Ed Van Sicklin "Still Here"
Reviews.Content: Switched to this camera after killing my Canon HS310 when a sudden squall in Panama soaked it.What most pisses me off with the 6300 is the lousy contrast performance. 80% of my subjects are in bright daylight and the Canon dealt with them much better than this camera.I just bought a Powershot SX260 so we'll see how their new one works outLike: Big zoom  SizeDislike:  Lousy performance in even medium contrast situations - blows out highlights  Self-timer requires it to be reset after every shot. Used a lot for low-light and self shots.  Slow! transfer to card, even with Class 10 card  Shot to shot is slow  Colors way off in low-light  Price should be lower for quality  Can't turn off flash in Auto mode

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera
Reviews.Author: camera enthusiast
Reviews.Content: I am going on my 4th digital camera in 12 years.  This is by far the worst one ever.  I usually upgrade with the times, but this one just died after owning it for 7 months.  Nikon support was useless.  Before the camera died I bought cheaper models and gave them away as Christmas gifts.  I wish that I had known about Nikon support before I supported their other products.In addition to the camera dying an early death, before that the camera took forever to take a picture.  I have had digital cameras before and if you have to wait 5 to 8 seconds before it takes the picture then you have a bad camera.  I lost a lot of times trying to get a good shot with this slow camera.  I am going to start supporting Cannon because of their customer service reputation.  Nikon Customer Service was useless.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: BeautyHairLoves
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted to start documenting vacations. The picture quality is great on this camera! I am not a professional photographer, just a young woman who wants to look back on good memories. The pictures come out pretty clear. I would definently buy this camera again.Pros:LightweightSleek appearanceGood picture qualityFast shutter speedHD quality videosGood batteryCons:Bulky*I couldn't think of any more cons, which is probably a very good thing!

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera.
Reviews.Author: bookend
Reviews.Content: We used to have a little Panasonic Lumix camera that took amazing point and click shots until I took it to the beach and got sand in the lense, and that was the beginning of the end for that.  Then when it came time to get a new one, I opted for the Nikon Coolpix S6300, which was more expensive than the Lumix and promised more features.  I rue the day I picked this camera.  The photos are soooo blurry, and no amount of trying different settings or resetting the factory settings will make it any better.  I have only had this camera for a month, and I'm so upset by all of the blurry memories we will have of this holiday season.  Do not buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera, Excessive time to turn on, Worthless AF
Reviews.Author: S. A. Degroote "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on specs and it looked very good on paper, especially the price.However...after using it for several weeks, it is difficult to turn on. The on-off button is too small and cannot be easily found, you must hunt & locate the button and press and hold. Press it too quickly and no dice. It will not turn on. Very, very annoying. Once the camera decides to power up, you do what it's designed to do: "point and shoot"...nothing happens...press the shutter once, twice, and maybe a third time before it's warmed up in time to take the shot that now, you've obviously missed. Next, try an action shot with the zoom, the auto focus simply does not work...AT ALL. It continuously hunts and blurs in and out of focus. Nikon should be ashamed to have their reputable name on this piece of junk.I ended up purchasing a Sony DSC-WX 100 which works great. The Nikon is collecting dust.

Reviews.Title: Do not purchase this camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph Silverio Jr
Reviews.Content: This camera is lackluster and the current reviews by camera magazines accurately depict it as a poor low light camera, fuzzy indoor pictures etc.  It has extremely poor battery life.  This camera takes worse pictures that my 7yo 4mpg Kodak camera.  And to back this up Nikon will not support you if you have issues.  There is no firmware update.  They want you to send it in to be repaired when the only issue is poor design quality.  Come on Nikon, you can do better than this, your reputation speaks better.

Reviews.Title: Happy with it
Reviews.Author: Radiant
Reviews.Content: Good solid camera that feels comfortable in the hand and pocket. Outdoor photos on a bright day are very sharp. Colors are accurate. Indoor handheld photos are better than those with my previous camera, a Canon sd1100. Taking videos is simple with good focus while zooming and panning. My only peeve is that the sound of the zoom motor is very easily picked up by the microphone while taking videos which makes me not want to use the zoom at all while shooting people. Overall, a good camera at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard in CA
Reviews.Content: I think some of the folks reviewing this camera must not know how to use it. You do have to make sure the video focus is set to auto full time in order to make sure the video refocuses as you or your subject moves about. However, 16MP, Nikon image quality, and the 10X optical zoom make this the best deal out there right now. I even dropped it and slightly dented the lens pop-out and it still works great!

Reviews.Title: New Nikon Coolpix S6300 stopped working after 4 months
Reviews.Author: Mou-Liang Kung
Reviews.Content: After 4 months of light use, the camera stopped working suddenly.  The camera was kept in a pouch and never dropped.  The LCD screen now displays no image, no picture can be taken either.  Resetting back to factory settings does not help.  All the digital cameras I ever purchased, this is the only one that does that to me.  Amazon's return policy covers only a month.  I do not know what to do next.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: DS-Santa Fe
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at the end of December 2012.  It died at the end of May 2013.  I only had taken it out for a couple of sessions during the six months that I owned it.  I took a few photos a few days ago to only have it die in my hand.  I should add that the battery life is very poor with the battery draining completely in one session (approximately 6 hours).  Save your money and find a better camera. UPDATE:  I'm trying to reach Nikon's warranty repair center off of their webpage with no luck - apparently their servers are 'unavailable'.  Poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: Nikon guy
Reviews.Content: This Coolpix S6300 is replacing my old S6300 which now has a nice resting place somewhere in the Pacific Ocean.....always use the included wrist strap.Anyways I ordered a new one this time in black instead of blue. This review will be on my old S6300 since its the same camera. I had my old S6300 for almost a year. In that time I took it on almost all family vacations and events. It delivered great results as long as you don't ask too much of it. Which allot of people fail to realize that it is a point and shoot camera not a DSLR....As for photo quality I'd say this camera takes better then average photo's. Noise isn't noticeable at ISO's lower then 1000 which is very good for a point and shoot.Noise at ISO 1600 isn't to bad either, its there but not in any way a distraction. You have ample room the crop photo's and the image sensor seems to have a dynamic range that is about on par with my Nikon D5100. But image quality isn't anywhere near as good. The reason being the image sensor on my D5100 is about three times the size.The S6300 gives good battery life of about 250 shots if you leave the camera in 16mp mode, if you set the camera at 16*mp (best quality) you will average about 200+ shots. Mind you this is not using the flash or reviewing pictures allot. Video mode does eat up battery life. You'll get about 30minutes of battery life in video mode. You'll also fill up an 8gb SDHC card quick if you shoot allot of 1080p videos. Video quality is very good in decent to good light. But in darker conditions it will produce grainy videos which again is to be expected from a point and shoot camera. The stereo microphones produce very clear sound and seem to have good range. However in quiet situations you do hear a bit of background hiss. This camera does have full optical zoom while recording video and the zoom speed is actually decent. Allot of cameras like this resort to digital zoom or they just slow down the zoom speed to try and quiet the sound of the lenses motor. Personally I'd pick a fast zoom speed to ensure I get the subject on video.As for the built in flash it does a great job of lighting dark rooms or areas. It doesn't overexpose or wash out colors too bad. Nikon seems to have this aspect of the S6300 almost dead on.The S6300's focus system is good but not perfect. In lower light it will struggle to find focus unless there is contrast or a clear color difference with the background and subject. Again its a point and shoot.The camera has a good amount of manual features but not too many. It also has a good bit of in camera effects and tools to fix up or change the way your pics look before you upload them to you computer.As for speed its about average. It powers on and is ready to shoot in about 3 seconds. From standby it takes about 4 seconds.Over all I liked the S6300 so much that I bought another one. Its the perfect size weight and has a great 10x zoom lens so you get almost everything you want. I could have gotten the new S6500 but I really don't think its worth it to spend $250+ on a small camera like this. So for the price the S6300 is selling for now I'd snatch one up before they run out of stock. Or you could just wait for the S6500 to drop in price.

Reviews.Title: Shutter Stuck open
Reviews.Author: Stacy Hammonds
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for our trip to Europe.  I also purchased the hard case to protect it.  We wanted a small camera that would easily fit in my purse or around our neck.  The first day, it worked great, and the picture quality was excellent.  On the 2nd day, the battery died within just a few hours into our sightseeing day, and the shutter lens became stuck in the open position.  I carefully put it in my purse until we returned back to our room. I charged it, and the lens still will not close.  The entire camera will not function. We have tried removing and replacing the battery, and it absolutely will not do anything.Because of the length of our trip, I am not able to return it. We spent over $200 for a camera and case, that does not work.  To say I am disappointed is an understatement.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: aask2
Reviews.Content: battery is an issue.  I bought two with the camera and have just started using the extra.  The battery that came with it didn't perform well.  Takes great pictures and video so far.update a month later...not a battery issue, at least I don't think so.  Camera works great. but the USB connection to wall charger does not. It does work for downloading pics to computer but doesn't charge the battery.  I bought a separate wall charger thru amazon from wasabi and that works well and you can still use the camera while charging.  Amazon serviced well but Nikon has a problem with the wall charger and USB connection.  Get the separate wall charger so you can still use your camera.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed.
Reviews.Author: EvieD
Reviews.Content: I did not have the camera 2 weeks and the lens in it started to stick and when I got online to see if it was going to be hard to fix I found out that this is a VERY common problem with the Coolpix and that Nikon is aware of it. I would not suggest buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: MJratesU
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace my very old, but very beloved Sanyo s770 after it recently broke. I paid 130 bucks for this camera and BOY did I get so much more than that. I'm an amateur photography enthusiast and this is such a nice camera for someone like me. The functions are amazingly easy to use and photos can be zoomed a LOT and still have perfect clarity. Video quality is good too! Even indoors, very minimal grain is seen in flash photos and videos. I must say, this camera requires a somewhat skilled photographer as motion photography tends to be especially awful. Holding the camera absolutely still is quite important. I would recommend this camera to anybody wanting a nice P/S camera to take along. Next camera I get... WILL be a Nikon.UPDATE:It is now 5/24/2014 and this camera was dropped, broken, and thrown away. It's not a tough camera, it broke after being dropped indoors from about 4 feet on carpet. It came open when dropped, which as we all know.. instantly breaks the camera beyond any real repair. I clicked it back together, but it was already gone. There was no way it should have broken. Displeased with how flimsy it was. Downgraded to 4 stars. Got a GE powerpro to replace it, was so upset by that. Too bad, I liked the camera. I paid $130 for this camera, the price is now for some reason astronomically higher than that. DON'T PAY $200+ for this camera! It's not worth that much. Get a newer Nikon model instead, or pick a Canon or something. This is a good little camera, but not worth over $200.

Reviews.Title: Best small size camera I have owned so far
Reviews.Author: Phyllis E. Abdur-rashed "grad student"
Reviews.Content: I have owned three small digital cameras. An Olympus Fe 4020, a Panasonic DMC-FH20, and a low end Kodack camera.  The Nikon CoolPix S6300 out performs them all. It's easy to use, lightweight, It takes great pictures both indoors and out, and the software that comes with the camera has some great editing features.  Overall if you are a novice like me, I think you will be pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Ok But Failed
Reviews.Author: M Tracy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to carry when on outings or vacation to supplement my phone camera.  I took it on vacation and it stopped working.  Simply went dead and would not charge.  For the four days it worked I liked it.  It is small and light weight and appeared to be taking good pictures.  The range of zoom was adequate and auto focus worked well.  Had it not failed I would have rated it  three stars.  I returned it and received a refund.  I don't think I will try another Nikkon for awhile.

Reviews.Title: Can't wait to take this camera to Disney World!
Reviews.Author: Wendy Kimberly
Reviews.Content: I've had a few Nikon cameras before so I know they have good products. Yet again, they do not disappoint! There is a very short processing time, which I love and I have a feeling it would be really easy for my low tech dad to operate when I need him. My previous camera, which was a Samsung, was good but the processing took too long and zooming in was a pain. Not so with this camera! Money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Great Birthday Gift for the GF
Reviews.Author: buddhatheonlyone
Reviews.Content: She really likes it a lot and that is all that matters. It has great features and can take some pretty nice photos for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for around use. The image is stable when using the zoom mode.
Reviews.Author: Frosty
Reviews.Content: All the local stores were selling this camera in red. Amazon had a good price on it in a few other colors. I liked the bluish purple one. It does not have a button to turn the flash off. I use the museum scene mode (no flash), closeup, and auto mode most of the time. It does not have a default mode when you turn the camera on, it comes up with the last scene mode setting. One main feature for purchasing this camera was the zoom works in the video mode. The 1080 videos have to be converted to a smaller size for uploading. I purchase the HDMI cable to display video and pictures directly to my TV.

Reviews.Title: Very slow response time
Reviews.Author: Leslie McGonagle
Reviews.Content: I thought this was going to be better than the Canons - but this one seems to have been defective.  By the time you want to take a picture, you couldn't get the camera open.  Then pressing the button - the response time was delayed - missing the picture.  Took forever to let the lense come into focus when you were expanding the shot,.

Reviews.Title: To late
Reviews.Author: A. McMullen
Reviews.Content: Should have listened to other reviews. Very Frustrated with this camera. I have not had good luck with these types of cameras. The lens  locks up on me. Several times I have had to  take the battery out , to get it to make any changes. Like turning off.  Do not recommend this camera, so disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Good HD Video
Reviews.Author: Gerardo Mazzola
Reviews.Content: This camera not only gives great photos, but has an awesome HD video recording output for the money. I like Nikon!

Reviews.Title: good size
Reviews.Author: ls
Reviews.Content: good size for carrying on bike or in your pocket.  Takes good pictures for distance, haven't figured out how to take good close pictures yet. very satisfied with purchase

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price!
Reviews.Author: lilly
Reviews.Content: fast delivery and a great camera for a great price.Love my pictures, they come out just great.A little slow on "click" button to take pics, other than that its great.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was SO excited to get a new camera and bought this about 6 months ago.  I get consistently blurry pictures and they are worse than my old Fuji 5.2MP camera when they are printed.  Great features, looks cool but doesn't get the job done. I keep thinking it is me not knowing how to use the camera but it might be the camera.  Had it about 6 months and the delete button no longer pops back up.  Disappointing!  Want a different camera but paid full price for this one (about $200) and don't want to spend the cash.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Laura Hogston
Reviews.Content: Love this camera,  I have only had it a few days but I am so thrilled with how easily it works and it takes great pictures.  I love the record button.  I have only had mine a few days, but I am a fan.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Worth to buy
Reviews.Author: Kamal
Reviews.Content: I bought this Nikon coolpix S6300 digi camera two weeks before and now I feel proud of having such a good camera. The Picture clarity is excellent.

Reviews.Title: A really good camara
Reviews.Author: KH
Reviews.Content: I bought this camara here instead of target becuase target's sale price was 30.00 over the price here and they only had red and silver.  My husband and I both love it.  The only little problem is the battery is not long lasting but we just bought the car charger/addtional battery kit that amazon sells for 19.99 to help with that problem so were are very satisfied with this camara.  I had a sony camara before buying the Nikon S6300 and the pictures are much better on the Nikon than on Sony.  To me that says alot.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera !!!
Reviews.Author: Rocking
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice product. Good photographs, picture quality is good even after complete zoom, very handy.Its worth buying ... I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware...May Be Too Good To Be True
Reviews.Author: Misterbanks
Reviews.Content: This camera turns out to be too good to be true.  I got it cause it was a good price, nice design, light, and long optical zoom lens.  I saw some sour reviews on it, but also some really nice ones.  So I decided to go with the nice ones.  But one thing that should have been apparent to me right away was that the screen to too low-res so you have no idea what quality the videos and pictures are that you are shooting until you pull them up on your computer.  One nice thing about videos is that you can pause recording and resume rather than having to stop and start again if you are going to do another video a minute later or moments later and don't want excess footage.  However there are several bad things I experienced with the video function. If you record video constantly for more that a few minutes the picture totally looses focus and blurs out completely and you have no choice but to start another video.  If you try to use digital zoom on video it gets very blurred zoomed all the way. On all my videos there was at least one or more random little dots of light.  That's just unacceptable, it ruined videos at an event I recorded for family.  Also if you are indoors the video is way too fuzzy.  I understand that's normal, it reacts to artificial light, but it shouldn't be this much.Finally, the pictures aren't always that great, the light fill, and compensation aren't too great all the time.As far as how long it takes between taking pictures..This is a 16mp camera so you really do need a class 6 or 10 sd card.Overall this camera was just too good to be true.  I could not ignore all the defects and flaws.  So I spent a little more and got an 18MP Sony camera and it is superior in every single way.

Reviews.Title: Great choice
Reviews.Author: Rx Gadget "RxGadget"
Reviews.Content: I researched this camera for a long long time. I compared to every plausible camera above and below based on options and reviews.  I did not compare price ranges as they varied from camera to camera.  Of the Nikon choices this is absolutely the best point and shoot available. I have used the s6000, s6100, s6200 and now the 6300 over the last few years.  Between my wife and daughter each camera was damaged and became unusable. For the price it was purchased it was much cheaper to buy the next version for the same price of the previous.  I chose the s6300 a second time without flinching.  Compared to Canon, Panasonic, Fuji, Sony, and others this model has the best optical zoom.  I do not count digital zoom as an option due to decreased picture quality on every camera.To sum the above up.: the Nikon s6300 out performed any previous Nikon model.  It's options, especially 10x optical zoom was not touched by any other point and shoot vendor or model.

Reviews.Title: Replacement for an 8 year old camera!
Reviews.Author: G. Fuller
Reviews.Content: It became time to replace our wonderful, old Casio camera that we loved. We wanted to replace it before it broke.We researched similar cameras and found the Nikon. We have just started using it but so far the pictures are excellent. Easy to use, much like the old camera, and we love how you get the close up feature! Took photos of the grandsons learning to water ski and am amazed at the excellent photos we got! Much sharper and closer than our old camera.I took some photos of raptors at a demonstration today and they turned out exceptionally good. So we look forward to many trips with the new camera taking both scenic as well as family photos.

Reviews.Title: Fuzzy pictures!
Reviews.Author: Carl R. Morris
Reviews.Content: Almost every picture I've taken with this camera is fuzzy. I don't know if it's the lens or the autofocus system or what, but I rarely get a sharp photo from this camera. I haven't had this problem with any previous digital camera I've owned.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: K.T. May
Reviews.Content: It's so nice to buy a camera and not feel the need to immediately return it.  I bought the red one, since it was $50 cheaper just for the color (really?  Who cares what color it is!  Shut up, and let me keep my money!).  It has incredible zoom, and the pictures are much clearer than those I have taken with any of my other cameras.  It even has a lithium battery, so you don't have to worry about continuously buying batteries, though the camera needs to be charged for a full four hours before it's operable at all, which includes when you first receive it.

Reviews.Title: 2 year owner ... Very unhappy.
Reviews.Author: D. Gilder "Deva ____"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for two years. I purchased it to replace my Olympus and wish I hadn't. This camera is horrible. If you are in natural light, or even artificial and the subjects are within a decent distance and not moving ... Then great. If you're at a concert, which I frequent, this is the WORST. Don't even think about taking a picture of people dancing. Don't even think about taking a picture of people not dancing. Don't even think about getting the picture to take when their is a certain point you really want to photograph because it will photograph the point AFTER. I took over 400 pictures at one concert and could only show 30. The video is actually pretty good, even from a good distance away, but why can't my pictures come out that clear? I'm definitely ditching this and buying the same type of Olympus I had before. I hate this thing.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera for Conditions That Aren't Too Dusty.
Reviews.Author: William R. Latshaw "WilliamL"
Reviews.Content: Love the camera overall - excellent photo quality and features. I replaced my old Nikon 4300 with this - it's a fraction of the size and weight. My only complaint is that I've had to send it in for service due to dust interfering with the lens extension / bellows assembly. Never had that happen with the 4300, but likely a common problem with all the new tiny cameras.

Reviews.Title: Very responsive camera, even better with Eye-Fi
Reviews.Author: Knowledgable Reviewer
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife to replace the S230 my kids broke.  Works awesome.  Some pocket cameras take a long time to process and save a shot before the next shot is ready.  This one's quick.  Other cameras have a bad delay from the time you push the button until it takes the picture.  This one is almost instantaneous.  It's not as fast as a DSLR, but you don't lose your shots either.  We've had several cameras in the past from the likes of Samsung, Vivitar and others, but we've liked all the cameras from Nikon.  They're responsive, slim and do they're job.  Add in an Eye-Fi card and life is even better.

Reviews.Title: THE WORST CAMERA EVER!!!
Reviews.Author: theatrebecky
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera ever! It does take a decent photo, when it takes it, but as that is only about 10% of the time. The shutter is so slow that by the time it actually takes the photo you have completely missed the moment, or the group is getting annoyed. I bought this camera in the hopes that it would be better than my Kodak easy share, which seemed to slow down and have a delay in taking the picture, but even after 6 years of use, and slow down, the Kodak is faster than the expensive Nikon. It also does not like to talk to the SD card, and half of my photos usually disappear from the card when I try to upload them. I HATE this camera with a passion and can't wait to get a new one.

Reviews.Title: Don't last a minute
Reviews.Author: dersa
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix s6300.. Actually I have purchased three in the last year. I did drop the first one but not the others. "Service" claimed that was the problem. I have a spare charger and batteries to guard against the short life. Nikon has been the highest quality camera for me - back to F1 - so these poor excuses of camera are a great disappointment. The telephoto has stopped working, and I usually just live with it when the results are poor. I really read the reviews today to see if someone had posted a recommendation for  similar sort of camera but one that works for much longer.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: smo "smo"
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd one of this model because my first one stopped working after 4 months, but the good news is that when I contacted Nikon, they fixed it for free!  I had already purchased another one because I wanted it for my vacation plus I am used to company's not backing their product but was pleasantly surprised with Nikon's customer service.  I highly recommend this camera if you are looking for something small that takes excellent pictures and manufactured by a reliable company.

Reviews.Title: Not as "solid" but great video features
Reviews.Author: Robert Popescu-Pretor
Reviews.Content: This not as solid as for example a metal body camera.But I got it for the supposedly great video capabilities and it did meet my expectations:brilliant colors (I love the red tones this camera has).

Reviews.Title: Great Family Camera
Reviews.Author: dan
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for taking pictures of the kids. It has a quick shutter speed so we don't miss a whole lot!! Great camera

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: K. Ledin
Reviews.Content: I bought this product over Thanksgiving, part of a Black Friday deal.  I wanted to get a camera to take pictures when our son arrived in December.  It's now August, and I'm still loving this camera!For the price, I think it takes awesome pictures.  The battery lasts forever.Over the last few months, I've noticed the camera is a little annoying with taking forever to focus and take a pictures.  I'm wondering if it's just my own fault, I'm probably not the most camera savvy person around.I was looking at getting a digital camcorder, but after getting this camera, I don't think it's really necessary. It takes great video too.  I've taken at least 30 video clips, and several hundred pictures, and am pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: It took 523 photos before it stopped working
Reviews.Author: Zebull
Reviews.Content: Initially I was impressed with this camera.  I took it on an African safari and it did surprisingly well when compared to the far more expensive SLR cameras.  But half-way through the safari, the camera simply refused to turn on.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S6300
Reviews.Author: Roswita Everhart
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for trips, theme parks, portraits, quick response photos and much more. The 10X zoom gets you close to the action without distortion and the auto features respond as well as larger and more expensive cameras. Great deal, especially at Amazon prices, more affordable than through most retail and even wholesale outlets.

Reviews.Title: Takes nice pictures; slowness can be eased
Reviews.Author: Zachary R. Hartman
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera for a while now, and it has been very good to us.  It takes nice pictures and has a pretty simple interface.  It can burn through the stock battery pack quickly, but we bought some extra ones cheap, and switching out is not a problem.At first, the camera operated really slowly, but we were able to alleviate that issue by putting in a higher-quality memory card.  So if you're having trouble, try addressing that aspect of your setup, since cruddy old cards will be written very slowly!

Reviews.Title: Easy to Carrry
Reviews.Author: Patricia K. Pingitore
Reviews.Content: It fits in a pocket and is easy to carry.  I took some good close-ups of flowers at a local arboretum.

Reviews.Title: Nice and compact camera
Reviews.Author: Douglas Bogard
Reviews.Content: I really like this little camera.  It takes very nice pictures and was value priced.  You can not go wrong with the Nikon S6300.

Reviews.Title: s6300
Reviews.Author: Gill L.
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take on vacation, and it's great! Small size makes it perfect for travel. It has a great zoom and takes excellent pictures! It's easy to use and has a great battery life.

Reviews.Title: not user freindly
Reviews.Author: mrfla
Reviews.Content: this is an okay point and shoot camera with a good zoom, but very confusing settings that seem to change on their own. i got this for my wife that is not too good at technical issues. we had a canon that was perfect but this nikon does not replace very well at all. Seemed comparable but isn't. Every time you turn this camera on, you have to go thru the settings to use what you want. it defaults to a setting where there is no flash. way too many icons with very little explaining. So now I have to buy another camera to replace it. One of the problems of mail order type purchases. No hands on to discover these sort of issues. i do not recommend buying this camera. i do have a dslr nikon that is a mac daddy, but this ain't it!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: crazyhollies
Reviews.Content: Was a perfect camera for the amount of money spent. Cannot complain about this nikon and makes perfect sharp pictures.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Mullins
Reviews.Content: I use my camera all the time. I love to take pictures. I am not a photographer but wish I was. The camera takes great pictures. Makes me think I'm a professional.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic S6300 SZ1 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Art Hall
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived just before we left on an extended trip overseas.  Even without time to check it out, the camera performed very well and delivered pictures with great clarity and depth of color.  We added a 16GB SDHC card to give us room for lots of pictures and didn't begin to fill it.  The only drawback  we have noted is one that is shared by most thin-line cameras.  The LCD screen gives a great preview, but some sun angles put a glare on the screen that makes it all-but-impossible to tell what the picture will be in advance.  So far, that has only resulted in one dismal failure-to-capture, but there are a few more that got discarded for lack of quality or poor aim.  Our overall impression is that the camera is a high-quality instrument.  Now, if only we could improve the quality of the photographer....

Reviews.Title: Very good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: sowjanya
Reviews.Content: Pros: very good for point and shoot.Cons: The zoom doesn't work as intended, it makes big noise, so while recording you get even the zoom noise.

Reviews.Title: wonderful
Reviews.Author: April L. Suarez
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great camera. I took it to Canada, and I took over 300 pictures. I could be far away and it brought everything close up. I would recommend this camera to a friend or any person. The price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Blue is Purple!
Reviews.Author: Oklahoma Buckeye
Reviews.Content: Thought I was getting the Blue one as advertised! Blue is Purple, had it packed up for return, then decided to keep it. guess I'm lucky it didn't fit in the UPS Night Drop box! Great little camera, just wish it was BLUE!

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: sunshine4
Reviews.Content: The camera was just as described.  I like all the extra features.  Easy to figure out how to use.  I recieved the camera quickly and in good condition.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S6300 16 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Arthur Fuller
Reviews.Content: This item exceeded my expectation. This point and click camera is easy to use and have great features. This item was received in an expedited manner. My camera was properly package. This camera came with a 16 megapixel memory.When I received this camera it was ready to use the only thing it did not come with was a charger, however the vendor I purchase this camera from had this advertised on the Amazon site, so I was aware the charger issue. I would not hesitate purchasing from this vendor againg.

Reviews.Title: Nice decent Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Manuel Compres
Reviews.Content: it takes very good pictures, it is very small and has a good zoom, the price is very good for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Lauri
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a trip to Costa Rica. It was a great camera and performed well. Pictures were sharp, zoom is great, and was super easy to use. Takes good video too, and that was easy also. The only negative thing I have to say about this camera is that when taking video, the battery drains super fast. Otherwise I was very happy with this Nikon camera.

Reviews.Title: Great gift go a young or older person in your life.
Reviews.Author: MohaMAD
Reviews.Content: Great gift for a clutzy, yet funny and talented, preteen. Much better than the hand-me-down camera she had. Great video and pictures. Simple to use and has settings for any avid photo/video skill level. Asked the preteen to read the instuction manuel for the camera and I knew that would be last option before testing the camera's settings. Must be intuitively designed and engineered for those who know everything. Any preteen parents? Her gandmother finds the camera very easy to use and her gandmother is willing to pass on writin instructions her grandchild failed to read. So far the camera works great and if you could view the pictures the preteen has shot you would not wonder about our future as adults. You would run.

Reviews.Title: Good Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Joe Mercer
Reviews.Content: I don't normally shoot point and shoot cameras. Bought this for my wife. But it works well. Good pictures and the video is good. I recently did a short promotional video in Peru with the 6300. I didn't have my DSLR with me so I was forced to use it. Did a very good video. When edited it look good. Good point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Terry Moore
Reviews.Content: The price was not the best but okay.  The camara is easy to use and takes great pictures.  I hope it lasts.  Costco sells the camara with an 8GB card and case for a few $s less.

Reviews.Title: not for action shots
Reviews.Author: momo1
Reviews.Content: love the clear pics this camera take a but have a hard time getting clear action shots. with two little kids, most shots ate action. I would recommend for stills but not action.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Huey
Reviews.Content: We added this camera to our collection because of the brand and ease of use.  We have Full Body Nikon cameras but this one will fit in your pocket.  We also purchased this camera as a gift so our Grandson could utilize his creativity energy in a positive fashion.  Looking forward to good results!

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: This camera meetings all my needed at a fair price. The pictures are sharp and vivid. The camera is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Still learning
Reviews.Author: anette aldrich
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday gift. So far so good but delete is tricky. I have cleared all pics in error already.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Meier "Video and audio perfectionist"
Reviews.Content: This is my first Nikon and so far I'm very much impressed with what you can do with such a small camera.  Apparently size in today's cameras does not limit its capabilities.  Beautiful pictures and the ability to take panaromic shots makes this camera even more special along with it's High Def video function. I would recommend this camera for the average user and I think those with more photo experience will be surprised how well it does its job.

Reviews.Title: This camera takes excellent pictures!
Reviews.Author: Donna G. Puk
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a compact superzoom with a CMOS sensor at a reasonable price. This fills the bill exactly.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeniqua
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for taking pictures on a vacation. I not only took several pictures, I also made some videos.  There was no problem with the battery (but I purchased a $46 pack that had a case, 16MB SD card, and a 2nd battery).  I could go on & on about the great pictures and videos that I took with this camera but to sum it up I LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Rick the Realtor
Reviews.Content: This is a great camrea for my real estate needs. Easy to use. Takes pictures quickly. Great quality. So many features I have yet to use. Will get there someday.

Reviews.Title: Worth the purchase!
Reviews.Author: Jason Anschutz
Reviews.Content: I was given a digital camera from a family member years ago, the Cannon Powershot 200. Over the years, the camera got worse and worse on battery life and ended up sucking the battery enough to only have the camera on for a few seconds and the camera would then automatically shut off. I new then it was time for a upgrade. Surfing the Amazon site, I came across this camera (Nikon 6300) and read the reviews. I also knew Nikon was more recent and current than Cannon (that's why I switched digital camera brands). This camera has enough bells and whistles I need to get the job done, though I am not a photographer. This product was absolutley worth the purchase and a very good digital camera for anyone looking to upgrade or either have something that's decent and will last a while. A great product is worth it when you need it the most!

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix S6300
Reviews.Author: Sandy Eggo
Reviews.Content: A really good value, it far exceeds my expectations. Nikon is the best. I am not a camera expert but this camera is soooooo easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Lizzie
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great little camera.  Particularly have fun with the telephoto lens, and the ability to capture a photo in sepia, or even black & white.  The only imperfection occasionally has been lighting.  Sometimes I get way too much, but that possibly could be controlled by changing settings.  What I've learned: when using, always put one hand through the strap loop (the hand you're not using to click with) so in case it slips or falls, it doesn't crash to the ground. I love the ruby red color.

Reviews.Title: Fragile Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Yoder
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S6300 is certainly a handy size and has many desired features. One precaution should be observed, however. When my camera turned up with a damaged LCD screen, having never been dropped nor abused, I was told by sales personnel where I purchased it that it is extremely fragile and can suffer such damage in normal use. This was confirmed during a conversation with Nikon personnel while discussing its repair. Just be aware that you must protect it and treat it very carefully.

Reviews.Title: I expected more from a Nikon...
Reviews.Author: Raul R. "Raul R."
Reviews.Content: After having a Nikon Coolpix from 2006, I figured it was time for a newer and better camera. So, being very happy with my Nikon I decided on another Coolpix. I received the camera quickly from Amazon and at first I was pleased. It has a decent LCD Screen, decent Zoom, and the color if beautiful. BUT... that all stopped when I went to charge the camera... The thing would not charge! I tried charging it from the PC and I also tried charging it from a few outlets in my home... Just to make sure it was not the camera. It was the Camera... I sent it back for a refund. Nikon's inspection quality seems to not be what it used to. I am not looking at a Canon SX260 or a Panasonic Lumix ZS20. It could have just been a fluke, but when your a company that has been around for so long and a company who is known as one of the leading camera manufacturers, you need to be on top of everything and you cannot afford a mistake like this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price
Reviews.Author: pzzler
Reviews.Content: I had a camera just like this one for years and it finally was malfunctioning. I wanted another one just like it since the pictures were so easy to take and always turned out beautiful. The video is wonderful. I found it to be the same quality as the higher priced video cameras and so easy to operate!! The extra plus; it is so little that it fits into a pocket or purse very easily.

Reviews.Title: Misinformation and poor support
Reviews.Author: Mr Joel Mason
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me clarify that I am not a very tech savvy person; in fact, I don't even own a smartphone and I categorically hate dealing with any new tech device I get. Trying to understand the content of the manual for any tech product is comparable to having a root canal for me.  To avoid as much frustration as possible, I referred only to the Quick Start Guide. I started out by charging the battery.  In the Guide it distinctly says to charge it until the blinking light goes off, which will take approximately 3 hours and 50 minutes.  Sure enough, the blinking light turned off after approximately that time.  So I assumed that the battery was fully charged, and proceeded to take a couple of pictures.  At least I knew that I could not take more than that without first buying a memory card, but I wanted to try it out anyhow. Then I tried to delete the pictures, but was unable to do so no matter how many times I followed the exact instructions in the Guide. Out of frustration, I called Nikon tech support and explained the problem.  The tech lady said that she would send me a link to download the manual, even though I repeatedly told her I was following what it said in the Guide.  Very helpful advise, yes?  No!  I then tried to download the View NX2 Installer program which consists of three modules.  As soon as I stated the installation, I got a message indicating that I had to use a newer version of the program by going to the Nikon site.  I did that, but I still don't have any idea if all three modules were downloaded properly.  I still hadn't solved the problem of deleting the pictures I took, so I Googled the problem (yes folks, I do use the internet out of necessity) and read someplace in the mass of information that the battery needs to be charged overnight.  I did that, and was then able to delete the pictures.  I will now use the camera but only in fully Auto mode, because I would never be able to figure out all of the other modes, menus, and sub-menus.  I will also not call the Nikon tech people because I would probably be sent another link to download the manual.  Most of you will simply shake your head after reading this review, but I have a feeling that there are a number of others out there who get just as frustrated as I do when dealing with something that is advertised as being simple and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Frank Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to give as a present and after seeing all the features and the quality of the photos, I purchased one for myself. You get really good photos and quality videos. A great camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: zooming in and out while recording produces blurred video
Reviews.Author: Vichai007
Reviews.Content: I got this camera less than two weeks ago right before Mother's Day, and I have used it to video record two indoor events the past two evenings.  Both times the video is out of focus when zooming in and out even though I set it to Full Time AF in video recording settings.  Let say I zoomed to position 5 and the video was perfectly focused.  I then zoomed in to position 4, but now it was out of focus.  When I zoomed in more to position 3, it was focused again.  If I zoomed out to position 6, it was out of focus.  If I zoomed out more to position 7, it was then clear again.  There is something not working with the focusing mechanism of this camera.Besides focusing, the camera can't operate while it's charging.  You can't watch the recorded video or pictures while it's charging.  My older Canon can do that, and that model was 2+ years old.  I am returning this camera.

Reviews.Title: Ordered New...Got Used
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Kirkpatrick
Reviews.Content: I ordered a new one in red and got a a blue one in a box with the red camera on it. Upon further inspection I noticed that the screen had fingerprints on it, it was missing the camera strap and all  the accessories were opened. I was very disappointed because it was obviously used even though i ordered a NEW one.  Amazon agreed to replace it right away we'll see if it happens.  But so far I'm NOT impressed.  I will right another review when I finally get the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: Really like this camera.  Its solid and takes great pictures.  The optical zoom is fantastic for such a small camera.  I would recommend an extra battery for it as I only get 2-3 hours of solid use of the one.  I bought this nice set http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004VRQNS6/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00 which I couldn't beat for 20 bucks.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Photos
Reviews.Author: KK8511
Reviews.Content: No matter what setting the camera is on 95% of the pictures come out blurry. I have a 2 year old niece that is rarely still and I can not capture a single "action" shot. There is too much lag between when you press the button and when the picture actually takes

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: Teresa Dodd
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a second camera as there are times when it's not convenient to carry my large DSLR.  I have been very disappointed in the quality of the pictures.  The pictures are grainy and don't have the sharpness I demand from my shots.  I expected much more from Nikon and especially after doing so much research prior to the purchase of the camera.  I thought perhaps there might be a small learning curve but I have yet to have a quality, clear, un-grainy picture from this camera!  I'll be using my iPhone in future for times when I can't take my DSLR, and chalk this one up to an unhappy lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: I am not usually picky, but I hate this camara
Reviews.Author: Jessica Herbstritt
Reviews.Content: This camara takes terrible photos.  they are fuzzy and blurry and I am not that unsteady.  I thought it was possibly the settings and after doing much research, there is nothing to do to correct it.  It freezes up if you take too many photos in a limited time frame.  It is not user friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We bought two of these for our kids (if you haven't given your kids a digital camera you are missing out).  I have been a fan of Nikon for a long time and this camera does not disappoint.  It is so easy to use.  My kids grasped the basics in minutes.  The pictures are crisp and clear.  And after a few weeks my kids figured out all of the advanced features of the camera.  They take all kinds of amazing pictures and edit them right there on the camera.  It is amazing how creative they can be with the camera.  Also, the battery is exceptional.  They go days without having to plug in.  So over all I would highly recommend this camera for anyone looking for a simple point-and-shoot.Just wanted to add that we went on vacation with two of these cameras and they performed great.  We took pictures in direct sunlight on the beach, at dusk on the beach, inside our hotels and homes, we used black & white, color, took video (including slo-mo) and both cameras worked great.  We have a DSLR but it ended up being used rarely because these Nikon's are so small they fit in your pocket yet still take exceptional pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Holly Fowler "Holly"
Reviews.Content: I read alot of comments on cameras and decided on this Nikon, I was tired of replacing store bought rechargeable batteries that would not last.The battery on this has been charged once and everytime that I have wanted to take a picture of my child when she is acting crazy or just looking super cute, the camera has been ready to use. I am waiting to recharge when the battery is over half deminished. This hasn't happened yet, so I am very happy with the camera.It also takes great pictures. It is a little slow to take pictures, there is a delay between taking each picture. This is fine with me as long as the camera will take good, pictures and hold a charge.

Reviews.Title: Dissappointed
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is decent but only four months after my wife bought this camera it started acting erratic.  We never dropped the camera or exposed it to extreme temps or any moisture and it is kept in a padded case at all times.  The main issue is it would not access the pictures on the memory card for review.  Finally we had to send it in for service.  The service took about 4 weeks to get the camera back (only cost was postage).  We feel the camera is over priced for the issues we have experienced in such a short time.  This camera was supposed to replace an 8 year old Cannon power shot which never gave us any problems but we wanted to update to a higher resolution camera.  We would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Freeze's up!!!
Reviews.Author: Helen Abreu
Reviews.Content: Great photos..however, this is a brand new camera and I shouldn't have to remove the battery to get it working again... Very disappointed.. Returning it...

Reviews.Title: Muy satisfecho
Reviews.Author: Angel Zambrano
Reviews.Content: Compre esta Cámara y al recibirla todos mis amigos quedaron encantado, es muy buen producto, lo recomiendo para todos aquellos que quieran una buena camara

Reviews.Title: SURDY, EASY, & USER-FRIENDLY, EVEN IN THE HANDS OF A 6 YEAR OLD. (This is my kid's camera)
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: My young son (age 6) saved up a lot of birthday and chore money, and wanted a camera. I, an avid photographer, navigated through a lot of reviews of options within his price range, and settled on this (Nikons are also my personal fave, which also nudged us towards this one). Out of the box, I loved that it was easy for him to understand and learn his way around. He can turn it on, zoom, autofocus and take pics, and navigate through the basic settings on his own, keep an eye on the battery, and get it charged on his own when need be. The small size made it easy for his small hands to hold securely and steadily, an the metal body made it a sturdy option for a child. Some of his pics come out blurry, but I chalk that up to him not yet having a grasp on how to shoot for nice, crisp stuff. I can get decent shots with it--mind you nothing like my Nikon D7000, my own camera--but of satisfactory quality for someone who just wants accurate, depandable shots with a handful of bells and whistles on an easily totable and user-friendly camera at a price that doesn't break the bank. Granted, if you want a serious camera for artst high-hobby stuff, you might want to look at something more designed for that, like a good SLR, but for basic point-and-shoot, non-serious stuff, this is a sturdy, easygoing choice that was a good buy. I eally love the simplicity and dependability of it; my kid never had to track me down and ask for help, and can carry and care for it on his own without me having to drop what I'm doing to fuss with it for him. If it's sturdy, light, and easy-to-use in the hands of a six-year-old, I assume prettymuch anyone will find it simple, sturdy, and easy to drag anywhere. Someday, I'd love to help him into something suited for bigger-britches photography, but this has been the absoloute perfect choice for him at his level, intentions, and price range.

Reviews.Title: Great cam for the price
Reviews.Author: Tiny
Reviews.Content: Nice camera and features. Very easy to use with vivid pics. Love everything except for the color which isn't really blue but more purplish.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Deborah Moore
Reviews.Content: It would have been nice if somewhere on the box it would have said that you can only store 7 pictures on it with the sd card.  I sent my daughter to camp for a week and she could only take 7 pictures.  I have bought an SD card and so we are ready for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: I like the zoom the most...
Reviews.Author: Margarita Z Turcotte
Reviews.Content: ..for such small practical camera but I had the bad luck of getting one that gets the lens stuck.  Luckily, I found out that removing-off and on the battery it retrieves the lens back.  I tried to return it but I had just missed the date.  I am going on a trip to Europe and I hesitate to take this camera with me.  I just feel it’s not dependable.  If some can recommend me another one I would appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S6300
Reviews.Author: DSP
Reviews.Content: I did not have good luck with this camera; the battery was constantly "exhausted" but even when it was working the pictures were not as crisp and clear as I would have liked. At one point, another traveler used my camera to photograph me and commented on how poorly the camera was working.After getting back home, I attempted to download my photos on to my computer, but the USB cable was not the one pictured in the manual. I ended up having to use the SD slot to accomplish this task.All in all, I won't be using this camera again; I am truly disappointed in all aspects of it.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS JUNK
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Warden
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware, I have had two of these Coolpix brand camera's that I bought around the same time and I also have a friend that recently bought a Nikon Coolpix and they do take good pictures WHEN THEY WORK!  All were hardly used when the Zoom and lens doesn't either retract or go out and/or the lens doesn't open all the way......DO NOT BUY THESE NIKON COOLPIX CAMERA'S..............THEY ARE TOO MUCH MONEY TO SHORTLY BECOME JUNK!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little digital camera
Reviews.Author: FloridaMiz "FloridaMiz"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It was easy to learn how to use and takes great pictures and I was able to get a driver from the company so it works well with my Windows 8.1 now.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: crys
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!!! Not outrageously expensive and works beautifully!! No Problems in over a year! Very happy with our purchase!

Reviews.Title: Pretty bad camera
Reviews.Author: A. Valdes
Reviews.Content: It came on time and well packed, however the camera leaves a lot to be desired. The zoom is 8X however it is very hard to focus if at all possible at that exposure, it has also a very slow shutter between pictures, I expected a much better product from Nikon at $150! I am even thinking of returning it.

Reviews.Title: after using the camera
Reviews.Author: kayak101
Reviews.Content: Used the camera for a period of time now and the camera works well. Good pictures and easy to operate. Excellent battery life.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: lauri
Reviews.Content: This was a nice little camera for my daughter in law to toss in her purse to capture pictures of the kids.

Reviews.Title: Broke in less than a week
Reviews.Author: hbault
Reviews.Content: This was broke before I even got to really use it! Very unhappy. Nice color, that's all I can say positive.

Reviews.Title: Very handy camera
Reviews.Author: Alan
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures, easy to operate, reliable  and very handy to carry in a pocket or jacket.  Just what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Worth buying twice
Reviews.Author: Joseph F Ruzicka
Reviews.Content: This Nikon Coolpix S6300 camera replaces an identical Nikon Coolpix S6300 that I carelessly dropped on concrete pavement and broke.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Clifton
Reviews.Content: I like the camera, I still would love one day to be able to afford one where I can switch out the lens for different uses. I'm still learning all the options about the camera which takes a little time to understand. If I could see a improvement a how to video would be nice as part of the package.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Chelsea Dunick
Reviews.Content: Great little camera for the price! Takes nice pictures and is small enough to fit in your pocket easily. I'd definitely recommend this camera for those who would like a quality small digital camera for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Great great great
Reviews.Author: susanmx
Reviews.Content: I am really pleased with this little camera.  Bought it for a great price.  Takes great pix.  Was worried about it being a little used but looks brand new.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: All Access Customer
Reviews.Content: Nice clear pictures. Second coolpix I owned the first one was great just worn out. I love the rechargable battery and the price was very reasonable. The shipping said thirty days but I had it in four.

Reviews.Title: 2 thumbs up.
Reviews.Author: D. Martinez
Reviews.Content: This is the best pocket camera I have owned for the money. resolution is great and operation is as simple as it gets..

Reviews.Title: NIkon S6300
Reviews.Author: Les Singleton
Reviews.Content: Such a mighty camera in such a compact size. I am amazed at the power of the zoom lens to pull in distance images that then do well in print.

Reviews.Title: Long zoom mechanism is not reliable
Reviews.Author: Bluesman
Reviews.Content: I'm a lifetime Nikon fan. Do not buy this camera. The long zoom mechanism is not reliable. It sticks and has trouble focusing. To get it to focus, we have to repeatedly power up the camera, or repeatedly half push the shoot button, very annoying and time consuming. It also does strange exposures on indoor pictures. No flash are often underexposed orangeish, with flash are often overexposed whiteish. To get a good indoor pic, you have to shoot every indoor pic with and without flash. The only good shots we get are after numerous focus cycles, on even contrast shots, like solid green vegetation.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable camera and warranty "repair" was useless
Reviews.Author: D. E. Brown "Largo"
Reviews.Content: The camera only worked indoors and not outside even when brand new. If I took it outside on a cool day or when it was humid, the camera wouldn't work. I sent it in for repair under warranty and they returned it saying nothing was wrong with it so they didn't fix anything. Calling and talking to them didn't help. I will have to throw a brand new camera away. It is rated to 32 degrees F but it stops working at much warmer temperatures than that. Very disappointed. I expected better from Nikon. Will never buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Awsome little camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Milas
Reviews.Content: Awsome little camera. Takes great pics. Easy 2 use. Small enough to carry without you even knowing it is there

Reviews.Title: Basic. Brilliant. Straightforward.
Reviews.Author: Nor'west "NWP"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a shirt-pocket camera that would take really competent pictures. This is that!Brilliant screen, excellent features, bright, well-focused images! Very useful!

Reviews.Title: Issues
Reviews.Author: T. McMichael
Reviews.Content: This is a fine camera, and it takes good pictures. I am pleased with the battery life too. However, I've had it for about a year and it freezes sometimes while zooming in, and I have to remove the battery to get the lens to return and close. Also, it is having som focusing issues. You just have to switch it off and start over. I'm careful with my equipment, so I don't understand this one. One more thing, the black around the LCD is coming off revealing the gray underneath. Cosmetic but worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: Had to send it back, terrible pictures
Reviews.Author: L. McC
Reviews.Content: I had to return this camera because the pictures were always blurry, unless you zoomed in all the way and took an extreme close up of someone's face.  I tried every setting possible, and nothing allowed this camera to take a clear picture.  I am somewhat confused why this camera has such great ratings, unless I ended up with a faulty camera.  So disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: A customer
Reviews.Content: I got it used and it arrived in excellent condition with all attachments. The camera seems to have the usual functions some of which I've only begun to explore. It's compact and easy to use. My only gripe is that I've had it for only a month and it froze for no reason. On/Off button, zoom, menu buttons, nothing would work. I finally had to pull out the battery and it finally reset itself. Obviously someone returned this camera because of this. However, considering how little I paid for it, and unless it develops other problems, it might be worth bearing this one malfunction.

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Dead on arrival!  Ordered for a X mas present and she opened it on Christmas day and the camera was not charged nor would it take a charge just a total embarrassment

Reviews.Title: Great price, great quality
Reviews.Author: Becks "Yay, books."
Reviews.Content: I've had 3 previous models of the Coolpix cameras.  I think for the price they are a really good point and shoot camera with a great lens.  The lens seems to make the difference with these models in the price range.  Cameras try to get people roped in with megapixels, which is only the size of the image, if the lens is crappy, the full size will not look sharp.  When you learn how to use this camera the settings capture crisp photos in all situations, of course I have a still hand so that helps.  The video in this one is incredible, just like the previous models, I can take this to shows and film right next to the speaker and capture pretty good sound, which makes me happy.  This has been the case with the previous models over the last 8 years as well.  Coolpix has not let me down.

Reviews.Title: Generic Packaging, No warrenty information at all.
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: When this Nikon S6300 arrived in my mailbox it was not in the original packaging. Everything was wrapped in bubble wrap and placed in a plain cardboard box. There is no warranty information whatsoever provided in the box. It seems to be in ok condition but I suspect that it is a refurbished unit, considering the fact that the original packaging is non-existent.I have only had it for one day now so I do not know how it is going to perform. I will update this later.It was shipped promptly and arrived only 4 days after I had placed the order, so that was impressive!The 3 star rating is because of the packaging and warranty issues already mentioned.

Reviews.Title: Love the color!
Reviews.Author: Lynda E. Smith
Reviews.Content: I like the size of this camera.  I haven't downloaded my pictures yet, so I can't rate that aspect of the product.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Mom of 5
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera in May of 2013 to use for use by the family.  We were replacing a Sony Cybershot that we had for about 5 or 6 years that just got dropped one to many times.  We wanted better than a (NON-smart phone) cell phone quality pictures, so we bought this camera.We had several problems and within 6 months had to go back to another Sony.  We found that while it took great still shots, it had the following issues.1.  The battery included with the camera would not hold a charge for more than about 30 pictures without flash (10 with flash) or a 1 min video.2.  Any movement would blur the image (not great shutter speed).3.  The response time when taking pictures was about a half second to a full second (most of the time longer than shorter)  from when pushing the button to when the picture was taken.  This caused a LOT of missed pictures.4.  The multi picture per second was not a reality.  Two pictures in a row would take about 2 - 3 seconds response time when pushing the capture button after the first picture.

Reviews.Title: Bought it for myself.
Reviews.Author: Theresa Salvanti
Reviews.Content: I hardly take photos so I do not have enough experience with this camera to give an accurate opinion.  However, I do think that there are too many options on the camera itself, and the function buttons are too small.
